amendment.description: Amendment modifies language in the bill allowing for the use of graduate students in the collection of recreational fishing data; clarifies that guidance prepared by the National Academy of Sciences regarding the economic benefits of commercial and recreational fishing within the mixed-use fisheries is to be given to the south Atlantic and the Gulf of Mexico councils; modifies the provisions in law regarding the council review of limited access programs to include not only the benefits of the program, but also any adverse impacts; finally, the amendment includes language to allow stock assessments to include information from universities, fishermen, fishing communities, and research institutions, in addition to State and Federal fisheries data.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 5 printed in House Report 114-128 to provide for additional information for stock assessments, the use of students to collect marine recreational fishing data and clarifies information for Council reviews.
